intro: Jambolifera heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved jambolifera, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that vary in shape and size depending on environmental conditions. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds.
